snippet: A police spokesman in Suffolk County said it appeared the blaze, which consumed areas in Manorville and Ridge last month and damaged at least 10 homes, “was not caused by natural acts of nature.”
lead_paragraph: Less than a month after a sprawling fire on Long Island damaged at least 10 homes and forced many residents to evacuate, officials have characterized the blaze as arson, a spokeswoman for the state's Department of Environmental Conservation said. A police spokesman for Suffolk County said it appeared the fire, which consumed areas in Manorville and Ridge, ''was not caused by natural acts of nature,'' though the department had not yet determined if arson was the cause.

headline.main: State Officials Looking at Long Island Fire as Arson
